The Rules (modified from TDC) - please read them!


  1. General
    1. The site-wide rules apply. Pretending to break these rules is also against the rules.
    2. This a game, so in addition to playing to win, have fun and do not intentionally ruin the fun for other players.
    3. You may never quote anything you received as PM from me. You also may never quote anything from a quicktopic. This does not apply once the game ends.
    4. Do not try to hide information within your posts by using encryption, invisible/white text or similar means. Spoilers are allowed, as long as they are clearly visible. If you are unsure whether what you're trying to do is allowed or not, please PM me.
    5. If you're dead, you may post one "bah" post only if this "bah" post does not contain any game-related information. You may not post anything more than this until I declare the game to be over.
    6. I am not a lawyer, so if you think the rules have holes, please let me know. If you exploit such a hole, expect to be punished.
  2. Voting
    1. Votes should should either use the vote tag or contain a bolded word "vote" and something that I can trace back to one of the players, such as a whole name or an abbreviation. (vote: nham) Please make sure that I understand whom you mean to vote for. Otherwise, your vote will not count.
    2. If it looks like a vote to me, I will count it as one. If you are unsure whether what you're trying to do would be considered a vote or not, you may PM me.
    3. If at any point during the day any player has received a majority of votes, that player is lynched. The day will end and I will announce the player's death as soon as possible.
    4. Unvotes are not necessary, but the other players might appreciate them.
    5. You may vote: No Lynch. If half of the players are voting No Lynch, the day will end without a death.
  3. Deadlines
    1. All game days will have deadlines N+7 real days after the post announcing the start of the day, where N is the number of players alive at the time of that post.
    2. At the deadline of the day deadline a majority of votes cast is needed to lynch.
    3. Nights will have deadlines 72 hours after the post announcing the start of the night.
    4. Night actions not received by the night deadline will be randomized. If you want to not use your action (and it isn't compulsive), send me a message explicitly stating you don't use your ability. It will be randomized otherwise.
    5. I reserve the right to alter any deadline under extreme circumstances, but I will try to avoid this.
  4. Participation and Replacements
    1. I expect each of you to post in thread at least once every 60 hours. You will be prodded if you fail to do so.
    2. All prods will be announced in thread by me.
    3. If a player does not answer a prod by posting in thread within 48 hours of the prod or if I have to prod a player repeatedly, I will replace that player.
  5. Endgame
    1. At any point, if exactly one faction has living members or nothing can prevent this from occurring, the game ends, and all members of that faction win, and all other players lose.
    2. If all players in the game are dead, then the game ends in a draw between the factions of the last living players. All players not in these factions lose.
    3. If it becomes impossible for any faction to become the only faction remaining, then the game ends in a draw between the factions that contain living players. All players not in these factions lose.
  6. Information
    1. I will try to post a vote count near the top of every page or every 24 hours (if you produce more than one page per day).
    2. The first post will always contain the most current vote count and any other information that I feel might be helpful.
    3. In the first post I will include links to the Rules, the Setup Preview, any Day or Night Scenes, any replacements, and the Setup Reveal as these items become available.
    4. In every vote count, if a player would be lynched at deadline, I will list that player in bold in the votecount.

Setup Preview - This is a semi-open game with modular roles (heavily modified from TDC's modular roles)

All roles are as follows:
You are a Role Name. The game thread is located here. Confirm by PM stating your role name.

Abilities
  • Ability 1: Description
  • ...
  • Ability N: Description
Modifiers
  • Modifier: Description
  • ...
  • Modifier N: Description
Groups
Spoiler: Group Name
Group Properties
  • Single Faction / Neighborhood
  • Day / Night / No Talk
  • Optional Other Property
Members
  • Member 1
  • ...
  • Member N

Faction
  • Faction Name
You win when all living players are members of your faction and at least one member of your faction survives, or nothing can prevent the same.


Note: Any player may only use one ability per night.

List of Abilities:
  • Cop Investigate: Each night you can investigate another player to determine if that player is a member of the Town faction.
  • Gunsmith Investigate: Each night you can investigate another player to determine if that player possesses a Kill ability or is a member of a group with a Group Kill.
  • Motion Investigate: Each night you can investigate another player to determine whether or not that player used an Ability (including Group Kill) that night.
  • Role Investigate: Each night you can investigate another player and receive their full role PM (minus group information).
  • Vanilla Investigate: Each night you can investigate another player to determine if their role PM matches the sample Vanilla Townie role PM at the end of this post.
  • Bodyguard: Each night you can protect another player. If the targeted player would die, instead they live and you die. The targeted player survives regardless of how many Kill abilities were used on them. The Kills are still detected by Track and Watch abilities as visiting the targeted player.
  • Hide: Each night you can hide in the house of another player. Any Kill targeting you will fail, but still be detectable to Track and Watch abilities. If the player you hid with dies, then you die.
  • Jailkeep: Each night, you target a player, and that player is both Roleblocked and Protected for the night. See those abilities below for their effects.
  • Kill: Each night you can choose to kill another player.
  • Protect: Each night you can protect another player. If exactly one Kill is used against the player you protected, that Kill will fail, but still be detectable to Track and Watch abilities.
  • Roleblock: Each night you can block another player. They will be unable to use their own active abilities or any group abilities. Any abilities they attempted to use will not be detectable to Track and Watch abilities.
  • Track: Each night you can find out whom another player targeted that night.
  • Watch: Each night you can find out who targeted another player that night.

List of Modifiers:
  • {N}-Shot: You may attempt to use each ability that you possess only N times over the course of the game. The count of attempts is separate for each ability you possess. Group Kills are not limited by this. N is always a positive integer.
  • Even Night: You may only use personal abilities on even numbered nights.
  • Odd Night: You may only use personal abilities on odd numbered nights.
  • Backup: You may only use any personal ability after someone with that same ability has died.
  • Bulletproof Vest: If on any given night, exactly one Kill is used against you, that Kill will fail, but still be detectable to Track and Watch abilities, and you will lose the Bulletproof Vest modifier for any future nights.
  • Compulsive: You must use an ability each night.
  • Godfather: If Cop/Gunsmith/Role/Vanilla investigated you appear as though you have the sample Vanilla Townie role PM at the end of this post.
  • Macho: Bodyguard or Protect abilities do not prevent any kill attempts made on you. Jailkeep abilities used on you will roleblock but the protect will fail.
  • Miller: If Cop/Gunsmith/Role/Vanilla investigated you appear as though you have the sample Scum Goon role PM near the end of this post.
  • Non-consecutive: You may not target the same player two nights in a row.
  • NK-Immune: If any Kill ability is used against you, that Kill will fail, but still be detectable to Track and Watch abilities. You survive regardless of how many Kill abilities are used against you.
  • Strongman: Each night you may choose to cause any ability you use that night to be unaffected by any roleblock, protect, or jailkeep. If you do so, you lose the Strongman modifier for any future nights.
  • Weak: You die when you target a a player that is not a member of the Town faction.

List of Group Properties:
  • Single Faction: All members of the group are mod-confirmed to belong to the same faction.
  • Neighborhood: Members of the group may belong to any faction.
  • Day talk: In addition to the game thread, members of this group may also discuss the game outside of the thread at any time only in the provided quicktopic.
  • Night talk: In addition to the game thread, members of this group may also discuss the game outside of the thread at night only in the provided quicktopic.
  • No Talk: Members of this group do not have any additional method of communication other than the game thread.
  • Group Kill: Each night, one member of this group may choose to use a Kill ability. That member may not use any of their personal active abilities, unless these abilities are Free.
  • Lovers: If any member of this group dies, then all members of this group die as well.

Sample Role PMs:
You are a Mafia Goon. The game thread is located here. Confirm by PM stating your role name.

You each wake up in an unfamiliar village in an unfamiliar place. You have no idea how you got here. But each of you knows (and you don't know how you know) that some entity called God Mod brought you here to play a game. A deadly game. And the gallows is already set up in the center of this village.

It is now Day 1.

Spoiler: part1
I didn't want anyone to make my case for me, or to simply answer with a, "Yes/No", answer. I didn't want anyone to do anything specific. This helps us see how players are generally reacting to the game, who's paying attention and catching the little things, etc.

This I follow
Spoiler: part2
I was expecting smart/cautious townies to react much like Abaddon did, saying something along the lines of, "Yeah, I think I see what you're saying. However, I want to see if our thoughts corroborate. What are you seeing?" or perhaps, "I've went back over his post and I still don't see anything. I'm calling your bluff." (Though I have a feeling the general reaction from the town was less, "I've went back over his post," and more, "I'm calling your bluff anyway.") I expected some comments about having my case made for me, but I thought a reasonable town would try to work with me a little bit without handing me a case -- especially from those who had a town read on me. It was well within reason to put the burden of proof on me and still have this work, but I digress.

I figured scum would be more apt to just blurt out what they saw wrong with the post, looking for approval and hoping to get easy town points. Alternatively, I was expecting scum to be critical of my approach without much consideration of what Sable Tip's post actually says. Why pretend to go scum hunting when you can just attack a player for his strange approach to the situation and get away with it? The drawback is that you have to take this with a grain of salt because a townie that doesn't know any better could easily do these same things, but nothing is ever concrete in scum hunting. Still worth it to see who does what, though. I was trying to get everyone's reaction to both Sable Tip's post and my own, though I mostly got the latter. Regardless, I still think there's a bit of good information here we'll be able to use.

I do not buy this though, there is NO WAY that post was a reaction test. Maybe it was retrospectively one, but there are so many better ways to reaction test than this. The question “does anybody else see…” means either (1) that he wants us to say, “no, show us” or (2) that he has a good reason to refrain info, or (3) that he isn’t actually sure there is something off. SO I have a few problems with this. First, if this was a reaction test, as he claims, then why is he able to so perfectly explain what is wrong below? If what he says below is true, then why would he find it scummy for someone to say “yes, blab la bla” Second, If Toxic wants to reaction test based on sable tip’s post, the way to do it would be to get sable tip to say something showing that he did not consider the issue that Toxic is bringing up. Something about his parama read, or even telling Sable tip what is wrong and seeing if Sable tip has a bad response to that.

Spoiler: part3
As for Sable Tip... Doesn't anyone find it odd that his 3 suspicions (Cheery Dog, Abaddon, and Parama) are all suspicious of Radelle (to varying degrees), but he lists Radelle as a neutral read? If I had any confidence whatsoever in my reads, and all 3 of my suspicions were expressing doubt over the same player, that player would be pretty far up my town reads list. I'd expect him to list Radelle as leaning town at the very least. He's not being consistent with his reads, and that's scummy. Also, he hasn't really provided why Parama and Abaddon are scummy, unless I am to take it that being aggressive and harsh is somehow scummy.

So here are my thoughts:

1. We need to do an analysis of the NK's up to this point. Given that night actions are definitely randomized if one isn't sent in, we need to figure out why only Thor died.
2. It is possible that scum intentionally left their NKs unsent so that they would be random, and NK analysis would thus be useless. However, this would intentionally be giving up their control over who dies, which trumps any benefit from truly randomized NKs. Has anyone here ever seen scum who actually, truly just picked some random guy to NK? All of them that I've ever seen had scum talking about who specifically to kill.
3. Trollie claimed to kill Cheery N1, and we have no reason to doubt him. Why, then, would scum kill Tommy? He was hardly the most townie of players.

For the Thor thing, here's the possibilities that I can see.

1. Scum and Trollie both targeted Thor. This would be silly, since Thor was easily one of the most suspected players in the game. However, I've seen scum do stupid things like this before, so it's not impossible.
2. Scum targeted someone else, Trollie targeted the same person, and Thor protected that person. This would lead to the question, who did they both target?
3. Scum targeted Thor, Trollie targeted someone else, Thor protected that person. Again, this would be stupid, but not unheard of.
4. Scum targeted someone else, Trollie targeted Thor, Thor protected person that Scum targeted. I could see this, because Trollie seemed to want to kill Thor yesterday.
5. Scum targeted Thor, and Trollie is 1-shot.
6. Scum targeted someone, Thor protected them, and Trollie is 1-shot.
7. Scum targeted Slandaar, Trollie targeted Thor. Why the hell would this happen? Incredibly unlikely.
8. Scum targeted Thor, Trollie targeted Slandaar. The first part would be stupid, the second part would make sense, because Trollie would have an interest in confirming Slandaar's story.
9. Scum targeted someone, Thor protected that person, Trollie targeted Slandaar. This would make a lot of sense.

Most of these would be resolved by Trollie telling us who he targeted.

Going along with this, Konowa is off limits, because lynching him would be stupid without some sort of confirmation about Sherlock's alignment. Even if Sherlock's right, Konowa might be a godfather, so I want to play it safe.

I don't want to kill Jacob, because doing so would be a complete shot in the dark from my perspective. Scum in a single two-man neighborhood is extremely unlikely, and we'd be playing Russian Roulette with it.

Trollie should obviously not be lynched, because we need to assume he's not scum for now. He also needs to do what the town as a whole agrees, because 1. that would lead to more discussion, which we really damn well need right now, 2. it would allow the town as a whole to decide rather than a single person, and crowdsourcing is actually a good thing, 3. if he's a SK he needs to be chained.

This leaves toxic and kwll. I do not at all buy Sherlock's argument that kwll is town, because from what I can see it's based on gut, and as I've said many times, I don't buy gut. I say we lynch kwll, partially because he's completely unreadable to me, and partially because of the process of elimination.

That leaves toxic, who may or may not be NK'd by Trollie. I can't say I have a scumread on toxic, but as I've said, my reads up until now have been complete crap, so I don't know. The only strong read I still have is on Slandaar.

Assuming we lynch kwll and he flips scum, Sherlock should investigate either Jacob or toxic. Since Jacob's more up in the air for me, he may be the best bet, because like I said, I don't like Russian Roulette.

Assuming we lynch kwll and he flips town, well, we need a backup plan for what Sherlock and Trollie should do. Sherlock may still want to investigate Jacob, because hell, why not. Trollie should still probably go after Slandaar. We'd be in a far worse position, though.
